pageContext.claim: “They said nobody is going to approve it; everybody is going to be against [criminal justice reform]. It's been many, many years, numerous decades, and nobody came close.”
pageContext.analysis: Significant criminal justice reform has had bipartisan support since at least the Obama administration when similar legislation was introduced.  Plus, the First Step Act builds on the Fair Sentencing Act, which was passed and signed into law in 2010.
